org.usfirst.frc.team1736.lib.MotorCurrentEstimators

Class CIMCurrentEstimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team1736.lib.MotorCurrentEstimators.CIMCurrentEstimator

  • public class CIMCurrentEstimator
extends java.lang.Object
    DESCRIPTION:
    Current draw estimator for full-sized (2.5") CIM motor plus nominal wiring. Tweaked around FRC1736's 2016 robot. Given a applied voltage and speed, the current draw is estimated. This is useful for determining if a driver command will draw too much current. Treats a group of motors as a single current-drawing device (useful for single side of drivetrain where all motors run the same speed). Estimation is based off of a whitepaper by FRC1736 from the 2016 competition season.

    Whitepaper link: Current Estimation.

    USAGE:
    1. Instantiate Class with proper values
    2. Call estimator function during periodic loop to estimate motor current draw

    • Constructor Detail

      • CIMCurrentEstimator

        public CIMCurrentEstimator(int numMotors,
                           double controllerVDrop_V,
                           PowerDistributionPanel pdp)
        Sets up the current estimator with the system parameters.
        Parameters:
        numMotors - Integer number of motors in the gearbox system. Usually 2 or 3 for a side of a drivetrain, or 1 for a single motor.
        controllerVDrop_V - voltage drop induced by the motor controller, in V.
        pdp - Instance of the PDP class from the top level (needed for voltage measurements)

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentEstimate

        public double getCurrentEstimate(double motorSpeed_radpersec,
                                 double motorCommand)
        Determines a unique file name, and opens a file in the data captures directory and writes the initial lines to it.
        Parameters:
        motorSpeed_radpersec - The speed of the motor input shaft in radians per second. Measured from an encoder attached to the same mechanism as the motor(s).
        motorCommand - The command sent to the motor (-1 to 1 range).
        Returns:
        The current (in amps) drawn from the motor under the speed/voltage conditions given at the input.
